text:
Ali Asghar Khodadoust (27 October 1935 – 10 March 2018) was an Iranian eye surgeon. He was born in Shiraz, Iran. He specialized in corneal transplantation. His reputation was the result of in his many studies on corneal diseases and transplantation biology.
Khodadoust died on 10 March 2018 in New York City of coronary artery disease at the age of 82.
